alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:28PM EST until January 10 at 8:01AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Delaware... Christina River At Coochs Bridge affecting New Castle County. For the Christina River...including Coochs Bridge...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Christina River at Coochs Bridge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins in fields and floodplain adjacent to the river. At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins in the town of Christiana. East Main Street (Del 7) begins to flood as does Water Street. Meadow Road near New Castle Airport is subject to flooding. Barksdale Road near Casho Mill Road is also subject to flooding as are residential backyards. At 11.5 feet, Portions of Duross Heights near New Castle Airport begin to flood including Don Avenue. Airport Road at the New Castle Airport begins to flood as the Christina River backs up the Nonesuch Creek. Walther Road in the Bear area also floods. Flooding also occurs around Smalley`s Pond Dam in Christiana. At 12.0 feet, Significant flooding occurs on Meadow Road in Christiana. Roads are closed. Homes are flooded. Salem Church Road and Reybold Road floods in Christiana also flood and are subject to closures. Residential backyards can flood in this area. Flooding also occurs in Newark on West Chestnut Hill Road and South College Avenue. At 12.5 feet, Evacuations are possible in Duross Heights. Airport Road at the New Castle Airport floods is closed. Businesses are flooded. Flooding increases in Newark. Flooding also increases on Barksdale Road and can extend onto Casho Mill Road. Businesses on South College Avenue take on water. At 13.0 feet, Flooding increases. Evacuations also increase in the towns of Newark and Christiana. Roads become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.5 feet and cresting. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 PM EST Tuesday was 12.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with a maximum value of 12.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.4 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (11 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Christina River Coochs Bridge 11.0 12.5 Tue 11 p 4.3 MSG Cresting &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 815 AM EST.
